Reviews.Title: “Worth our stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: SpyrosA_Greece
Reviews.Content: + Clean, atmosphere, location, design - No English (thats a common problem in BCN) Far from metro station (10 - 15 min by foot)

Reviews.Title: “Great, smart boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmiemoo
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel, decor was really nice and felt very comfortable in the hotel. Nice staff and very nice area, which is near to town. some nice bars near by although we didn't really find any nice restaurants near the hotel, it was mostly sandwich bars and a slightly odd all you can eat! Oh yeah I also got a marriage proposal in the room too! (I said yes!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dansilhan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on business. A great little hotel. Parking is a little out of the way, but then when is parking convenient in Barcelona? A little far away from public transport also, but in a great location if you're looking to be close to Gracia without having to suffer the congested streets and noise. It is true that the rooms are a little dark and the lift is slow (so take the oh-so-elegant stairs!) Rooms are nice and breakfast is great. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JuJuLondon
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel, I had a panic and thought it was too far away from everything. However we were so happy to be walking around such a beautiful easy to get around city that we didn't care. We walked everywhere, and sometimes got a taxi home. The hotel rooms are great, it is a boutique hotel, which means there is not lobby or bar, but that's fine with me. I have to say the ladies at breakfast were lovely, however they didn't clear tables and we were often left standing waiting for a breakfast table. I think they were not used to having a full hotel, we stayed 17th March weekend. We loved the food and we were really lucky with the restaurants we found. Go to the Garcia area, it's very local to the hotel and is very typical of where the locals hang out. I would do go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: Avocetboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed from the 15th to 18th Frbruary with my wife and my 5 year old. Had booked a Family Suite as we needed two sleeping rooms, My initial reaction was one of slight disappointment as we were allocated a second floor room looking out to the college at the rear. The room was very dark and I would not class it as boutique. Furniture was extremely sparse and the wooden floor did not help with the overall feel of the room. However, it was clean, and having two sleeping rooms meant that we could enjoy a glass of wine whilst the little one was asleep. Location is great. Plenty of cafes restaurants within walking distance, a supermarket round the corner and a Turistic Bus stop and Metro stop within 5 minutes. Bit of noise at night, but only to be expected in the centre of the city. Wi Fi in the room was excellent and there is use of a computer in the reception. Did not have breakfast, but room service coffee was good. It did the job and we loved Barcelona, but next time, I would prefer a larger suite and a few more luxuries.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect long weekend”
Reviews.Author: StephieLouJones
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Wilson through a Living Social Deal which meant we got a suite, Breakfast, Cava and fruit included. We upgraded our standard suite to the Attic Suite 801 for an extra cost which was more than worth it for the Panoramic views of the Diagonal and out across the city. The room was perfect and so spacious, with double sink and showers as well as a humongous bed which had been decorated with rose petals for when we arrived. The service at the hotel was fantastic right from the friendly reception staff who checked us in to the lovely ladies who served at Breakfast. The Breakfast was well stocked with fruit, meats, cheeses, bread and pastries. This hotel is perfect if you are looking for the design features and service of a higher star hotel and want to be close enough to the centre but away from the touristy areas, it is also within waddling distance of the Meatpacking District restaurant where I had the best meal of my life so make sure you read that review also!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LOU26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a two night break. Great room and great views from it, location good too. Staff friendly and helpful, but best of all for me, they returned my phone charger - Thank you so so much Wilson!!

Reviews.Title: “Fave hotel so far...”
Reviews.Author: HotelFan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights on a 'romantic break' deal. The suite we stayed in was huge, well laid out and with views from all sides of the room and a big, comfortable bed, felt more like an apartment then a hotel room. The staff were friendly and welcoming- the hostess at breakfast laid out a table for us by the window to give us a good view and another member of staff walked us to our room and carried my suitcase on arrival. The location is also really good. The hotel is in a nice neighbourhood and the tourist bus is only over the road so getting about is very accessbile. The hotel bar is self service so instead we visited a bar over the road from the hotel, Bar Velodromo. It was relatively inexpensive, quick service and nice atmosphere. All in all, a really good trip. The only suggestion I would make is to get a good map of the area with clearer directions to the metro. There is one local but as the streets are so long it can be hard to access straight away and there aren't many signs about to indicate its exact location.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Catherine F
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from spending 3 days in the Wilson Boutique and I am already looking at booking again for this year!! We stayed in a suite on the 6th floor which was just perfect. We had great views over the Diagonal. It is definitely worth asking for a room higher up. The hotel was extremely clean. The staff could not have been more helpful - advising us on which routes/transport to take, restaurants to eat at. The breakfast was also very good. Sausages, spanish bacon, eggs, breads, fruits, cold meats, pastries - my mouth is watering just thinking about it again! Would definitely recommend this hotel. For location, it cannot be beaten. If you are staying in Barcelona , make sure you stay on the Diagonal rather than the more touristy areas as you really do get a better area/location without having to pay an arm and a leg for it. It is surrounded by the more uptown restaurants and bars and we found it to be the nicest part of Barcelona (and we saw a lot!) . i just wish I was back there!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and design.”
Reviews.Author: sharone m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days in Barcelona which is a very interesting city to visit. Wilson Hotel was great. It's a modern and design place, maybe a little bit noisy, but nice and comfortable. We had a room at 5th floor with a nice view. Our room was decorated with style, bathroom was modern and perfectly clean. We also appreciated having a nice breakfast at the hotel before visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Demetris D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wilson hotel for a week in January. The hotel has no public areas except a computer desk by the reception desk and a cafeteria that served full breakfast in the mornings and self service snacks and drinks until midnight. The rooms have a fake minimalistic decor on the cheap side but still they are clean and comfortable and considering this is a 3 star hotel they are more than adequate. We had a junior suite facing the north side of the hotel (not the diagonal) and a small balcony which was a bonus. Location was not bad and taxis are everywhere and cheap. Barcelona is a wonderful city with so many attractions, excellent restaurants and the people there are very friendly and proud of their city. Overall we had an excellent holiday in one of the most attractive cities in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Wilson hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrightonBelle
Reviews.Content: Just back from a lovely few days at the Wilson Hotel. Was impressed with the stylish rooms and friendly staff. Stayed in a standard room and a suite and was happy with both, although a sofa or a couple of armchairs would be nice in the suite. However, it was lovely to see the great views from the 7th floor. We had a "breakfast included" option for part of our stay, and although I wished there were more vegetarian options, non-veggies will be fine with the selection of meats, cheese, eggs, pastries and fruit available. Best of all its served until 11am. The location is possibly not ideal for a first time visitor to Barcelona, or someone who wants to spend their time in the busy touristy areas, but it is in a quieter upmarket, very pretty and very safe part of the city and we didn't find the location a problem. Quite the opposite. It is about an 8 minute walk to the nearest metro (Diagonal) which is just 3 direct stops to Liceu on Las Ramblas, right at the heart of things. There are plenty of buses and taxis directly outside the hotel which would take you anywhere in the city. It was about a half-hour (pleasant) walk to the Raval and about a twenty minute walk to the cool bohemian bars and restaurants in Gracia. So all in all, I'd be very happy to go back to the Hotel Wilson - they were offering a great deal of 51 euros p/n just before we were there (January 2012) through the hotel's website. Fernando, who answers all the hotel's emails, is really helpful and speaks excellent English (and his French sounded good too). Thanks to everyone at the hotel for a great visit to this beautiful city,.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, nice staff - take earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: LynnWin
Reviews.Content: Just back from two nights. For me not really a Boutique hotel but very stylish and comfortable. The room/suite was open-plan with a dedsk behind the bed and open batch and double basin area. The bath was difficult to get in and out of and would not be suitable for the elderly. The breakfast was fine and served until 11. There was a noice of hot and cold plus freshly made tea and coffee to order. A little way from the Gothic centre and the Ramblas but easy to walk there, taxi, bus or tube. Taxis are quite reasonable in Barcelona. Airport to the hotel was about 30 Euros. As with all other places in Barcelona there is a lot of noise from the road so I would recommend you take your earplus. We spent another night on a boat B&B in the VBarceloneta area which was so calm in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and practical”
Reviews.Author: Kengele
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here, on my way through Barcelona. The location is very good as it is near Gracia, and is close to restaurants. The Metro is about 5 blocks away. The hotel is modern, clean, and fairly practical. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room has stylish modern furnishings, and was all I needed. Wifi worked, the lighting is good. The fancy modern shower in my opinion isnt that easy to use, as the door gets in the way, but aside from that I enjoyed my stay here. The street numbering is completely different on the south and north sides of Diagonal, so if you are following the numbers to find the hotel, make sure you are on the north side!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Sambeal1987
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a two night stay here and it was amazing!! We stayed in a suite on the sixth floor and the view was so amazing that my boyfriend proposed to me whilst we looked out over the city. The staff were incredibly friendly and were always happy to help. We didn't really understand the concept of the self service cafe and bar that they had but we enjoyed the buffet breakfast. If you ask the reception staff to recommend a place to eat they will give you a card for a restaurant around the corner where they have tables reserved for hotel guests...it was amazing!! The hotel is in a great location but in order to fully appreciate the city you are best getting a bus ticket for the tourist buses. Although they seem expensive and a little too 'touristy' they are a very good way to see some amazing places.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money Suite”
Reviews.Author: moromou
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend in the top floor suite. Nice balcony with views of Diagonal and the City . Not sure if I'd stay here again, but as a one off in that particular room (801), and for the price of 170 Euros per night including Breakfast, was a good deal. The room itself is fine, with a big comfortable bed, and the bathroom is also ok. As for the breakfast, if not in your rate, don't pay extra for it, as it's not worth it. The area around the Hotel is safe and clean, but lacking in any decent nightlife. However it's only a cheap cab ride to the centre of town, so no real issue with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Frankandjill
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious. Ours did not face the traffic but a giant metal grass hopper and the soothing sound of bell chimes. The breakfast was sumptious; no complaints there as by some. It is located on the longest street in Barcelona, Diagonal at 568, and is on Google Street view, and within walking distance to the blue and red HOHO. An excellent restaurant serving paella is located around the corner, Moncho's at Travessena de Gracia, 44-46. The hotel's clerks speak English. A 4 story department store with groceries and wine is nearby, El Corte Ingles, Hermosilla 112. The only negatives are: the shower floor is very slippery and like many European hotels, they do not provide wash cloths.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, room confusion, painfully slow lift, and tried to overcharge us!”
Reviews.Author: Lucyw0209
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked the romantic package for my birthday which included a suite with a round bathtub, double bed, living room, private bathroom, a bottle of cava and breakfast. Before we arrived we had looked on the website and had seen that the hotel offered parking through an arrangement with a nearby car park. There was no mention of having to pay for this. On arrival we found that it costs 45 Euros for 24 hours parking! We appreciate that we might have to pay but this is not a small amount and I believe this should have been stated on the website. It is sneaky and misleading to imply that the parking is free when it is actually VERY expensive. In addition the car park is about 10 minutes walking from the hotel. This is a bit of a trek with all our luggage and I would have appreciated if we could have parked out front the hotel and unloaded before going off to park the car – however this option was not offered to us. We were booked in by a standoffish receptionist and shown to our room. To say that the room had a living room would be an exaggeration (– a small desk with a chair?). The room was ok. It looked clean but I noticed a few signs of neglect such as hairs in the sink and slightly stained toilet bowl. In addition the bed was not a double but two single beds pushed together. The bathtub was certainly not round. However not being the types to complain we made do. However on the second day I decided to question why our bath was not round as promised. It turned out they had put us on the top floor which did not have a round bathtub but they would move us to a different room if we wanted. The man at the desk was helpful and accommodating and we were placated. Our second room was of a slightly better standard. However again - two single beds pushed together was considered a double (??). A few other complaints: Breakfast was ok. The food was nice but the orange juice was horrible diluted cheap squash. Despite asking on two occasions when we wanted our Cava sent to our room – they still managed to forget! The lift was a nightmare (stopping at seemingly empty floors, going up when you wanted to go down) and despite being on the 8th floor we eventually decided to take the stairs. When we checked out the receptionist tried to charge us for tax ON TOP of the room charge. I found this outrageous since when I peered over the desk, our booking form was sitting right there in front of here – clearly stating that tax was included! I corrected her and it was sorted. However we left with an extremely bad taste in our mouths. Our stay was not terrible but the few problems we did have were extremely disappointing and I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever but the rest was great”
Reviews.Author: sofiahanee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Wilson Boutique Hotel together with my boyfriends and 15 other friends, mostly couples in their late 20s. We all liked the style, rooms and location in the 'posh' area of Barcelona, close to good shopping, nice restaurants and great clubbing. I stayed in a 'suite' with my boyfriend which was more like a big room, but really nice and clean with nice view. Although the overall grade is good, I need to point out two big disappointments; the service and the elevator. The staff was extreamly unfriendly. In fact, I've never experienced such bad service ever in any hotel in any other city or country. I usually don't care if the staff can't speak English very well, but at Wilson, they wouldn't even try to understand or communicate when there were misunderstandings. We're decent people who never get into trouble, but during this stay we were treated as criminals. Especially the night watch was a total idiot. He literally yelled at us for being so loud that the other guests couldn't sleep. It was a Saturday evening and we had a couple of drinks in our suite with music on the cell phone. We were there for one hour. He claimed we'd been noisy the whole night and also the night before. We told him we weren't even in the hotel the night before, but he wouldn't listen. Obviously, if other guests are disturbed, they need to let us know, but it's not acceptable to scream at hotel guests, especially for things they didn't do. We talked to another group at the hotel who'd experienced the same problem. The staff had been yelling at them for being noisy three days in a row, calling their room to tell them to stop partying when they in fact had been sleeping. To add, on the hotel web page, it says the rooms are very sound proof. Also, the elevators took forever and one time we even got stuck. It took the staff 20 min to get us out, and when they did, they didn't apologize for their crappy fascilities or even ask if we were OK. All in all, I wouldn't stay there again, just because of the extreamly bad service and hostile attitude of the staff, even if the location and rooms were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great service”
Reviews.Author: John O
Reviews.Content: The room was a good size, nicely decorated with some thought going into lighting and layout. Free wifi, a cheap minibar and a big shower were bonuses. Staff were friendly, and although it wasn't completely central it was in a very upmarket area, within walking distance of tubes and a thirty minute walk from the centre. Would go back and would thoroughly recommend. One small quibble was bathroom door was glass (tinted) but was a bit 'revealing' if you are staying with family etc.

Reviews.Title: “Why did they skimp on the bathrooms?”
Reviews.Author: MooandJu
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel three or four times and always had an end of building or corner room (they have 180º vistas). But, in all of the rooms including, the junior suite, the bathrooms have had no thought gone into them whatsoever... despite the space available. They are small, cramped and badly lit. A severe disappointment considering the rooms (albeit, the 'corner rooms') are fantastic and afford you an unique vantage point of Avenida Diagonal. This area is packed full of shops, restaurants, bars etc, etc... And is a great central point to explore Barcelona's delights from. Once again, breakfast is not included in the price... but, that's Barcelona. The staff are extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Comfortable, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Sweetpeaks
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. We took a couples Euro Trip and this hotel was one of our favorites. I can honestly say the hotel did actually look like it's posted photos. The rooms were clean, comfortable and the location was in a nice neighborhood. We didn't bother to try the hotel breakfast. We took one look at it and decided to walk the streets as there were plenty of nice cafes. The bed was comfortable but the walls were quite thin. We had a nice big window with a view of the street. The buses in Barcelona are easy to use and the stops are almost everywhere. On this trip we visited the Ramblas which is definitely a site to see. We decided to try one of our tour book's recommended restaurants off the side streets of the Ramblas. It looked ok getting there but an elderly man was mugged right in front of us by a team of 3 young Spanish men. It was a sad sight and we decided not to try the restaurant. Just be careful and watch your surroundings. Don't wear fancy jewelry! Also, you must see the Picasso museum and the Sagrada Familia Church. Get the audio guide tour. You will learn much more as opposed to a tour book or just staring at it. Good to know: This is an actual city. It's not beautiful fields and what most people think Spain is. But there is definitely some cool architecture.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: KatesRoy
Reviews.Content: The room was a great value. It had a modern feel, a very nice shower, and the view from the balcony was very nice. The breakfast was a lovely spread, and the pedestrian walkway area right outside made for a nice easy stroll to the metro or elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fab fab fab”
Reviews.Author: Jono_Darwen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with another couple and it was fantastic. All the hotel staff are very helpful and happy to assist always with a smile on their faces. Our room was very modern very spacey and beautifully decorated with great views from up and down the Diagonal. Fantastic powerful shower although my wife wanted more light in the bathroom to do her makeup! Although the breakfast may sound expensive its definitely worth it. Fruits, cereals, breads, meats, cheeses, cooked eggs, sausage, bacon, cakes and all delicious. We didn't book with breakfast but after our first we had one each morning as it set us up for the whole day and didn't need to eat again until dinner. It's a great base to discover Barcelona. A 5 minute walk to catch the bus on the red or blue tourist routes and a 20 minute walk to the top of the Rambla. Lots of great coffee shops, bars and restaurants nearby. We will be coming back no doubt about it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: glenridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suite on the top floor and it was a very modern, clean and amazing room. We did book nearly a year in advance to get this room. The room takes up the entire top floor. It was not overly expensive and we thought it was a really good value for what we received. Good staff too. Big space, private large terrace (for the middle of a giant city) modern and confortable. Surrounded by windows and looking over the beautiful and bustling boulevard below. Very cool. It is several blocks to get to the Metro (which is an excellent way to navigate the city, by the way) however it is a very pleasant walk thru a thriving commercial neighborhood. More of the business/banking district than a tourist area. Which is fine by us. Walk a few blocks in any direction of the hotel and you will find plenty of shopping and restaurants, even a supermarket is a block away. Great breakfast places too. If you want to get away from the heavy tourist crowds and be near upscale residential and commerical areas, this is your place. It is about 8 good blocks to the closest Gaudi building and Metro station. Taxis are cheap and abundant too. The talk of not being sound proof is a minor issue. Sure you can hear the street traffic a little bit. But it does not bother me because I have lived in urban areas in the past. There were no other rooms on our floor so I cant comment on that. The washroom was very modern, clean and private. Only flaw was a tiny leak of water under the shower and onto the floor of the bathroon, nothing a 5 minute sealing job wont fix .. hint, hint. Loved Barcelona, great hotel as a base. I give is a Very Good only because I am a hard marker on hotels. Would stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MarGra17
Reviews.Content: spent a week in this hotel In August with my partner, as usual I spent hours on trip advisor before committing to this hotel but i couldn't have been happier with the outcome. I had request a balcony and was delighted that this request was adhered, room was lovely on the upper floors with a spacious balcony. Unlike many travellers, accommodation is high up there on my list of priorities, to cut a long story short don't hestitate with this wee gem, no complaints, a great find.

Reviews.Title: “nice place modern services”
Reviews.Author: erickMedellin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close (4 blocks from metro) on Principal Street, the rooms are moderns and the bath room is fancy and modern, the breakfast has a very nice and plenty of choice of ham and jamon Serrano. The Internet is not included, and if you are traveling by car, there is not parking lot,

Reviews.Title: “A little extra for a little luxery”
Reviews.Author: JoeUtica
Reviews.Content: The Wilson is one of those places you stay after you've sacrificed a couple of nights for the sake of your budget in other, lesser places and want to reward yourself. And what better place to reward yourself than Barcelona? The town is a jewel, and you see a nice hunk of it from the large expanse of glass in the Wilson's better rooms. A few posts have dissed the location, but the Wilson is on one of the main drags in the town's northwest quadrant, 10 minutes from the trendy Passeig de Gràcia (which runs north-south), a 20-minute walk east to the Sagrada Familia -- a must see before you die -- and a 6-Euro cab ride south to the throbbing heart of the old town on Los Ramblas. We walked there and cabbed back to the Wilson. Piece of cake, and I'm pushing 70. Achmed will grab your bags, suggest restaurants, and even walk you to the bus stop. I hope the hotel pays the kid what he's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: monikagrancanaria
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent; elegant, comfortable, clean, modern rooms, friendly and helpful staff, nice surroundings. Free internet. We didn´t have breakfast at the hotel due to our travelplans, but the coffee was excellent and reasonable prices at the bar/café. Busstop just around the corner, easy to get to Plaza Catalunya and metro a couple of blocks away. Sightseeingbuses stops just a few minutes walk from the hotel as well. We can definitely recommend this hotel when visiting Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “excellent and modern hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: richasa85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and the hotel was excellent. Staff was very friendly and assisted us in answering questions and storing our luggage. The rooms were modern, comfortable, clean, and quite. We had a triple room and the beds were comfortable. The shades were also great for blocking out the sun. There is a church next store that will ring it's bell every hour during daytime, so if you like to sleep in it may bother you, but we didn't mind. The location was good, a bit of a walk to the metro and Catalunya, but we didn't mind. There are several cafes in the area and an excellent all you can eat lunch buffet across the street called Fresco. Best of all was the value, under 100 euros a night. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet, clean and elegant hotel; wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Silvia1969
Reviews.Content: Pleasant room, elegant hotel in the centre of Barcelona (not in the old cenre but in the Exaimple); the breakfast was excellent, complete with penty of food and a lot of sweet and salted choice (the best espresso in 2 weeks of holydays between France ands Spain). The area is quiet and safe. Just 2 things to point out: we like to walk so it was not a problem, but it is at 10 minutes walk from the metro; try to avoid rooms at the 1st floor because they are next to the breakfast room so I supposed they could be noisy (we were at the 3rd floor and the room was very silent)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pippy100 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilson for 3nights and it was a pleasure. The Hotel is modern and the rooms were very nice. We stayed on the 5th floor overlooking the Diagonal which is a busy road but as long as your not a light sleeper it's fine. The only problem i did have was the lack of wardrobe/drawer space which for 3 people in 1 room was not sufficient even for 2 it was not great. You could ask for iron and iron board which is good as could not hang my clothes up. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel so cannot comment on the food. The metro was a little far from the hotel which when you have suitcases is a bit of a trek. Overall it is a nice hotel in a nice area and if you want a hotel a little away from the hustle and bustle of the centre then i would recommend the Wilson Boutique Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “'It's a lovely hotel, very friendly staff"”
Reviews.Author: Bello23
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely hotel, very clean and nice rooms. We got a room with balcony. It's located in a nice location, Diagnol, very close to lots of good shops, and cafes. Easy access to local buses and tourist buses, taxis. The Hotel staff are very helpful and friendly and speak good English. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location.”
Reviews.Author: Zoroklou
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a beautiful street called Diagonal. The building itself is one of the buildings you see in Barcelona and you feel like you want to stay there forever. Our room was good. The bed was big enough, the bathroom was great and modern and the view on Diagonal was excellent. We didn't have a balcony, just a window. While the noise from the street was not annoying, the noise from the room next to us ( a couple doing things that couples do :P ) meant that the hotel inside is not so soundproof, but this isn't something you call a problem, just a fact. The location is great. The nearest metro station for the city center and everywhere is about 1km, but the bus stops in front of the hotel, so even if you don't like walking, you have a solution. But that's not the reason I think the location is great. While the hotel is located in a business district of Barcelona, you have the Gracia area just 20 minutes away by foot. There you can actually see a different side of Barcelona, with quit Squares with local -non tourist- people enjoying their selves playing music on the streets and hanging around in the beautiful bars and cafes around. So you have Gracia pretty close and you have the city center just 2 stops away with subway. That's why the location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel, but failed to meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: SteveMa_UK
Reviews.Content: Travelling as a family of 3, with a young teenage son is never easy. This hotel appealed as it is one of the few hotels which allows a group of this size to book a single room rathe rthan the expense of two rooms. We booked what was advertised as a junior suite: "spacious Junior Suites" The main room contained a double bed, and in a separate "living" area, without intervening doors, a single armchair which expanded into a single bed. In this position it filled the remaining space providing just enough space to walk to the bathroom , or round to the window onto the balcony. The bathroom although well furnished had a sliding frosted glass door ensuring that there was at best limited privacy for anyone using the bathroom if anyone was in the adjoining"living" area. I did not make use of any of the other facilities in the hotel. there is a bar / lounge area on the first floor serving plastic wrapped sandwiches and "nespresso coffee" at extortionate rates. In the street next to the hotel there is an "El Fornet" cafe which provides an excellent coffee and danish type breakfast at a fraction of the price. Whereas the hotel breakfast was 15 euro each. the cafe provided breakfast for 3 each morning for less than 14 euro total

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: stinesh
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Wilson in july. The room (705 I think...) was very spacious for european standards. Furniture and decorations are in a modern style - very nice! I can se from other reviews that some people complains about noisiness, but this wasn't a problem with this room, since the windows faces out on a more quiet street than the Avinguda Diagonal. The terrace was quite large - perfect for having a relaxing lunch after spending hours shopping! Lovely! There's a computer avaible down at the desk, and free wifi in the rooms aswell. Staff is very polite and helpfull too. I've been to Barcelona once before, staying down by the Rambla. I would say this area is a much better choice! Lots of nice restaurants and shops. A supermarket is about a 2 min walk away. Attractions in walking distance is for example Casa Mila and Casa Battlo. Only negative thing I can think of is that it's a bit far from the metro, a 10-15 min walk. I would definitly recommed this hotel to anyone, aswell as stay here the next time I come to Barcelona!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money from this Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: signorands
Reviews.Content: Wow. This hotel blew us away. We paid EUR88 per night (advanced booking fee). Compared with other hotels, in Spain and elsewhere in Europe, that are in the same price bracket, this place stands head and shoulders above them all. For once the website pictures are a good indication of what you'll actually get. We had a large, modern room looking out on Avenue Diagonal. It's a noisy street outside, but with the windows closed we couldn't hear a thing. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Free wi fi access in the rooms. Free internet and printing on a PC in the lobby. It's a bit of a walk from the Metro station. A good 10 minutes from either Diagonal or Hospital Clinic. But there are numerous busses running past along Diagonal on a regular basis and once we've figured out the routes we had no trouble getting around. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “faultless, fantastic and friendly”
Reviews.Author: amold_72
Reviews.Content: Stayed in July 2011 for two nights. Very clean, comfortable and the staff make you feel very welcome. Rooms well maintained and extremely comfortable. For the money, you couldn't do better and believe me.Great location plenty of thing to do ,nice breakfast will be returning had a great time thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my expectations”
Reviews.Author: jprs29
Reviews.Content: This hotel completely went above and beyond what I expected. The staff was friendly and they would greet you with a genuine smile every time. My room was extremely spacious and clean. Eventhough I was on the first floor and facing the Avinguda Diagonal there was no noise whatsoever. The room had a balcony which proved to be pleasant specially to have a glass of wine before dinner. The hotel is very well located close to a lot of restaurants in the Eixample neighbourhood and great shopping in PAseig de Gracia. I am surprised this hotel is only 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Modern and Spacious Room!”
Reviews.Author: DanArnold
Reviews.Content: I was treated by my partner to a trip to Barcelona for my Birthday, where we stayed at the Wilson Boutique for 3 nights. It is a lovely hotel with helpful staff and the rooms are superb, very spacious and modern with a luxury feel to them. It's about a 20-30 minute walk before you get to the central bit at the top of La Rambla but we enjoyed the walk each day and on one of the days had an extended stroll down to the Marina and beach. I would recommend the Italian restaurant just a few minutes down the road (can't think of the name of it!) but if you turn left out of the hotel onto Avinguda Diagonal it is a few minutes down on the opposite side to the hotel. Lovely meal and nice wine too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: aldibran
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this fabulous hotel both pre and post our cruise! I would reccomend it to anyone! Although in some of the reviews,it states not much privacy to bathroom, etc, we stayed in junior suites, and found these rooms to be quite large by european standards ! bathroom area in both rooms on our stay were large, there is a glass door to pull between sleeping areas and bathroom, (bottom part is semi-opaque, and you can not see in, as well as the shower as semi-opaque glass door. The area around hotel has several cafes, bakeries, and tapa places, a grocery store is street behind, and extremely easy accessibity to transportation.Taxi to pier with 3 people 6 luggage on holiday(surcharge for holiday, and entry to pier) cost was 21.5 Euro.Staff were extremely helpful,all spoke enough english to get what you would need,some speaking very well. There really is no "lobby type to say to this hotel, although there is a computer station with printer available free of charge to print airline boarding passes etc. Also Wi-Fi is free of charge. IN other reviews before we went I read not so sound proof, and not really "black out curtains" dont know where these people stayed, but we also did not have any problems with noise, nor light.I consider this a great hotel to stay for the price, the staff who would get you anything you wanted,location,(yes you do have to transport to Las Ramblas, but walking the hotel neighborhood felt extremely safe.Tolietries were of high quality. They do have an all day type cafeteria, with a nice breakfast spread, which we did not utilize mainly because this is the one feature of the hotel that i would consider pricey. 12 euro per person for breakfast? And each cup of coffee was 1.5 euro(no free refill)Acup not a mug!But other than that I would highly recommend this hotel. We stayed in room 105 and 606 if this helps!

Reviews.Title: “chic and modern boutique hotel with nice location near great shopping.”
Reviews.Author: dimpliciouzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 days 5 nights, arriving very early from NY. The closest public transportation in the immediate area around the hotel is the bus. Metro is about a 10/15 min walk. Buy the T-10 pass at the Metro station to use on the bus and metro station. We managed to use the Aerobus from the airport and got off at Plaza Universidad to catch the 64. From there we had to walk a few blocks. Street names are not very visible so its helpful to know what the surroundings look like. Use Google Maps for this! The hotel is very close to great shopping - Zara, BCBG, Blanco, Loewes and more. If you walk in the other direction on Ave Diagonal you will come across shops for home design. We also took advantage of the large pedestrian/biking pathway that sits in the middle of the main road separating traffic. It was great to start our day with an early morning jog from our hotel all the way down avingdua diagonal. The front desk is very nice but some of them do not speak/understand english very well. If you are going to use the tour bus, buy your tickets at a discount from the front desk. Our room was a standard room on the 5th floor facing the back of the hotel across what seemed to be a small architect school and church. Our balcony was small but large enough that they fit 2 chairs and a table out there. We made use of this when enjoying a cup of coffee in the morning. I was pleased to find our bed was not 2 small beds pushed together which was the case when we travelled to Ibiza and Madrid. The room itself is very small with a small desk, lounge chair, mini fridge with drinks for purchase, closet and safe box. The safe box uses a key that you have to obtain from the front desk. WIFI is free just ask for the password at the front desk. The bathroom sink is very large not leaving much room to place toiletries. Only a couple BBC channels that are in English are available to watch on tv. The maid always came to clean our room and gave us fresh towels when necessary. They have a small self serve place on the first floor with coffee/soft drinks (same as in your room) and small sandwiches. There are so many cafes to go to for breakfast for a coffee and croissant outside though. You will find most also have outdoor seating. Also there are supermarkets around the area where you can buy snacks and water. Overall this hotel was modern and comfortable and great to come home to after a long day of walking and sightseeing. Contrary to what others have said about the noise it didn't bother us at night, but then again living in NYC we must be accustomed to it. After walking around the more touristy areas near las ramblas I would rather choose to stay on ave. diagonal again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: EKP90
Reviews.Content: As a young couple we booked this hotel for a 3 night stay mid April and thought it was ideal. Upon arrival we were swiftly checked in and helped to our room. The hotel is very clean and modern. Our room was a very good size with a king size bed and air con. Just a pre-waring that the shower room had glass sliding doors, which I expect could cause problems for some guests. The receptionist was really helpful with any queries we had and recommended the tourist bus, which worked out at 28 euros for a two day ticket if you got one of the vouchers from the reception. The tourist bus was fantastic and I would recommend it to anyone. I would definatley suggest getting the two day ticket if you are only staying for a few days. The hotel is in a perfect location on the Diagonal , which you can tell is the upper market side of Barcelona! and about a 15 minute walk to Las Ramblas. We didn't pre book for breakfast, but you can have breakfast at the hotel as and when you please, with a charge at the end of your stay. I think breakfast cost around 12 euro each, but was worth it as there was a large selection of full english, pastries, cereal, yoghurts, juices etc and you could go up and help your self as much as you pleased. There are also plenty of bakeries close by for breakfast too. There was also a mini bar packed full of goodies. It wasn't outragously priced, but I would keep track of what you take out as it all adds up very quickly, and you get billed at the end of your stay. We had no issues what so ever with this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh.....pass.”
Reviews.Author: ipushbuttons
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel due to the favorable reviews. First off my room smelled of sewage the first day we were there. Secondly the noise factor, not only from the street, but from the cafeteria down the hall from me was aweful. My room was oriented in a bizare way. The room was more hall than hotel room. If you are not intimatly aquinted with your travel guest you will be when you are done do to the bathroom set up. Overall you should pass on this place. There are better places in Barca for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice. No complaints”
Reviews.Author: GordonrSpain
Reviews.Content: Booked into this hotel for three nights after reading the Trip Advisor reviews. Called direct to confirm the facilities and to discuss which room was best for our needs. The desk service was very helpful and gave direct and honest advice. I eventually booked room 703 which has a large terrace overlooking the Diagonal. I also made arrangenment to have flowers and cava in the room for our arrival. The porter immediately relieved us of our baggage and transported it to our room. Check-in was efficient and quick and the requested additions were in place. The room was large, very clean, king sized bed arrangement as expected, and with a large terrace accessed from both french windows. We had cause to contact housekeeping and the staff responded within moments. We asked Reception for their advice on local restuarants which required less than a lottery win to pay for an evening meal. We chose one a couple of hundred metres away, which was exactly as they described - a local establishment which offered good food and local wine at reasonable prices (just under 30 euros per head for a three course with drink). We were out early and the bill was ready and accurate. There was also internet access from a terminal in reception. As mentioned in one TA review, the hotel reception is not spacious. However, I cannot see why this might be an issue. It seems preferable to have a large well appointed room and terrace in preference to a brightly lit, but wholly unfunctional entrance space. The hotel is situated midway between two tube stations and takes a good ten minutes to walk it. Not completely desirable if you have heavy cases so we would recommend a taxi. The tube is an easy walk when you are sightseeing. Although the hotel is glad to arrange a taxi on demand, we hailed one outside the door and the trip to Barcelona Sants cost just over eight euros. We will return to Barcelona again and will look no further for our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Electricity problem or overbooked?”
Reviews.Author: sleepwalker001
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 11pm, we were quite exhausted, because the way from the metro to the hotel takes about 20 Minutes when carrying luggage. At the check-in we were then told that our prepaid room is not available, because there is an electricity problem. We were then offered a room at HCC Covadonga (aboth 500 metres away, but not the rooms are not as nice). Nevertheless, I have a strong feeling that the hotel was overbooked and that there was not really an electricity problem. It seems we were not the only one facing this "electricity problem"

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: smith80
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we wanted to be away from the main tourist area (mainly Las Ramblas) in order to get a good night's sleep. Contrary to other reviews on here we found our room to be lovely and quiet and dark. Its location on Av. Diagonal is perfect if you like walking (although I believe there are buses from outside). We happily walked to the seafront, La Sagrada Familia and Nou Camp all from the hotel. After a hard day's walking around the city, it was really nice to come back to a quality air-conditioned room. The hotel is situated in the more upmarket area of the city, where there are plenty of nice bars and restaurants and a handy bakery for breakfast on the go just around the corner! The staff were friendly and helpful and the free Internet access in reception was a useful service. Despite a slight mix-up with our airport transfer on arrival (for which the staff were apologetic; I would suggest confirming with the hotel a few days in advance of your stay), I cannot fault this hotel and would recommend it to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good value”
Reviews.Author: buttonsWorcester
Reviews.Content: After the initial disappointment of a rather dark and dismal interior room with twin beds (we booked a double) we were pleased with our room once moved. Great views of Av Diagonal. This is really well placed hotel for restaurants bars cafes etc. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - rooms are far from soundproof.”
Reviews.Author: flyingscotsman2
Reviews.Content: The hotel website clearly states that all rooms are fully soundproofed. They are not at all soundproofed. I could hear the couple in the room next to mine talking - and more. The room doors slam shut, so if any of your neighbours are in and out of their rooms, yours will actually shake as their doors slam shut. This is a real pity, as otherwise it's a very good three star hotel in a great location. The room I had (507) was spotlessly clean and stylish, and everything else worked as it should. But my stay was ruined by being constantly disturbed by other guests, at all hours of the day and night. The little contact I had with the staff was okay. I liked having a stocked minibar which was replenished everyday and a balcony where I could smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: lila3008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in april with two friends. We all shared a room - a junior suite. The room was in good condition. We couldn't really complain about anything. It was all clean and tidy. The only small detail we would point out is that the walls need to be painted. As for us being 3 people in a room, one problem occured. The bathroomdoor was of glass, so it wasn't quite handy given the fact that we were 1 girl and 2 boys - but we made it work. The staff was friendly and ready to help and answer our questions. The location of the hotel was great! It is definetly in the luxurious end of Barcelona. It was a ten-minute walk to metro Passeig de Gracia from where we could take the train to placa catalunya where all the action happends. Placa Catalunya is 20 minutes away by feet if you like walking. The weather was great so we didn't mind. Also if you like shopping than this area of the town is absolutley perfect, with all the high-end shops being close to the hotel. You get great value for the money at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel on the Diagonal”
Reviews.Author: corgi22
Reviews.Content: Our room was at the back of the hotel, but was lovely and provided all the comfort we needed at the end of the day. The computer in the lobby as well as the self-serve snack bar on the first floor was helpful. We enjoyed walking the Diagonal into town each morning. The tour bus stops not far from the hotel, but all else is a bit of a walk. Still, we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: aytea
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights at the beginning of April 2011. The room we had on the 7th floor was one of only 2 with private terraces which were a real bonus. The stylish interiors were wonderful and of a high quality. The breakfasts were good with lots of variety. We loved quirky little features like the little projectors shining the floor nos into the Walls!

Reviews.Title: “Upset that Wifi did not work in room....cigarette smoke smell from the reception area at night......”
Reviews.Author: Marlao
Reviews.Content: We took a taxi to the hotel and no trouble finding it at all since it's on a main street. Hotel looked clean and well-kept. One young hotel staff was very helpful and enthusiastic to explain the hotel facilities and directions during our check-in. Unfortunately the free wifi didn't work in our room (which contradicted the main reason we chose this hotel) and I had to sit at the lobby/spiral staircase to "catch" the wifi signal. When it was late at night , there was cigarette smoke smell coming up through the spiral staircase from the reception area. The hair-dryer did not work as well and we were told same problem existed with most of the current batch of hair-dryers and not much they could do. Fortunately a replacement was found on the third night (out of four nights we stayed there; both my friend and I have long hair so this was important). There was not much of noise even though it was on a main street and we slept rather well. Nevertheless it was a bit of distance from the main action, and we did not manage to walk to the La Rambla - bus was advised by the hotel staff. The Barcelona city tour bus-stops was a 10min walk away. There was a Loewe shop just across the road and a nice bakery nearby which was good for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good price, a bit far from the action”
Reviews.Author: Allaboutchocolate
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, modern decor, excellent rain shower. Quiet despite being on a busy road. Outside of all the main tourist areas, so need to be prepared for some walking. Only other negative was the lady at reception who was, on every occasion we spoke to her, totally miserable, rest of the staff were friendly though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Daanber
Reviews.Content: Beautifull hotel, clean room with very good beds. Braekfast is also very good but there are also al lot of places nearby with good breakfast. The Bus Touristique stops nearby, which is great because not everything we wanted to visit was within walking distance. Staff was very kind and helpfull. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: smartkiltedman
Reviews.Content: We took the top room on the tip off the building which gave us windows on 3 sides and even a full balcony...what a view of the city! Room was spotless and smelled great...sheets were soft. Service and ownership A1. Just a very special place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wilson!”
Reviews.Author: jocboyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights while visiting Barcelona for our wedding anniversary. The staff were so helpful and welcoming. Rooms very comfortable and quiet. Only problem was we requested a king bed and got two single, however we just put them together and I am sure if we had mentioned it it would have resolved as nothing seemed too much trouble! The ladies in the resturant were also very eager to help. Perfect location, away from the madness of la Rambla but within walking distance of most attractions. We used the turistic tour bus (buy ticket from reception for reduction) stop was only a block or two away. Cannot recomend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilDowdell
Reviews.Content: A great stay. The room was modern with good facilities and a lovely terrace. The building is unique, an old building but with modern stylish interior. Our room 702 had a great terrace. Breakfast was pretty good. Overall very good value for money and in a great location. Certainly not tourist tacky Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Good for this price range”
Reviews.Author: TraveloverIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights over New year. The location isn't perfect but its a ten minute walk away from Diagonal metro station and the metro system is brilliant so you can go anywhere from there. Also a taxi from Las Ramblas was only around 7/8 Euro. The rooms are small but very nicely decorated. The shower was really powerful & roomy. Staff were very helpful & the mini fridge in the room is handy, there is a supermarket around the corner & its worth stocking up on snacks and drinks rather than paying minibar prices. The TV has no English speaking stations other than CNN & another news station and pay per view movies are not available so not much entertainment if you decide to have a night off from the bars & clubs. The internal noise in the hotel was really bad, and there were doors slamming all night long, we could also hear every movment of the people in the room above us. Had to buy earplugs in the local chemist to get some sleep. Overall though, a good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good new year break in Barca”
Reviews.Author: Ben_C007
Reviews.Content: Good hotel - very modern rooms. Location good - can walk to Diagonal tube station in 10 min or city centre in 30 min. Staff were welcoming and helpful when needed. One slight gripe was there was an annoying buzzing sound coming from the fuse box (?) by the door in our room. I had to trip one of the fuses to shut it up when sleeping! Had breakfast once - ok but a bit pricey for 12 euros unless you are a big eater! Would recommend for a city break for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: lizadan
Reviews.Content: Had a really nice 5 day trip to Barcelona back in November. Everything about the hotel was just as described on the website. The location is excellent; we had stayed nearer the Ramblas on a previous trip and found the Eixample district much better for food, bars, and generally getting to see the real Barcelona. The hotel itself is lovely - room was a nice size, shower was large too and we thought the 'honesty bar' was fantastic. It's lovely to be trusted in this cynical day and age. The staff were most pleasant and helpful too. We'll definitely be back. I have already recommended this hotel to people.

Reviews.Title: “Superb package, all you could ask for in a hotel without paying 5 star rates!”
Reviews.Author: Walkerna
Reviews.Content: Superb package, all you could ask for in a hotel without paying 5 star rates! Standard rooms are great, super shower, great size, comfortable bed. Stayed in 5 star hotels and resorts that need to upgrade their offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: M0nicaW
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night but I was able to tell that the hotel looked exactly like the website. The lobby was a little on the small side but nice. It took us a little while to get settled because the elevator was small and only two people fit with luggage at a time. We had a triple room with two twins and a rollaway bed. The rollaway bed was very comfortable which was a nice surprise. The bathroom was see trough. I would advise if you stay here to be very comfortable with the people in the room because you can see and hear everything that’s going on. The room was a nice size and even though we had a lot of luggage we never felt cramped. We stayed on a higher floor and had a very nice view from our window. The location was excellent. We were close to shops and restaurants within walking distance. The mall is close as well (although most shops and mall are closed on Sundays). We were able to catch the hop-on-hop-off bus about 3 or so blocks from the hotel. We felt very safe walking around the hotel even at night. I would recommend this hotel to friends. I would recommend if you don't want to be so close to the Rumbla which is nosey and crowed at night.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, good location, affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelAndWrite
Reviews.Content: After researching about Barcelona, I figure out that safety is one of the critical factors for choosing accommodation. Hence staying away from the tourist spots is a very good idea indeed. Thanks to Trip Advisor reviews, I found this hotel. We stayed here for 2 nights. We did not get a great view for one of the rooms, but we did not mind it as were out most of the time. They also checked us in with no hassle eventhough we arrived at 2 hours earlier than the check in time. We were happy with the rooms we have generally, although for the double room, we would have liked a little more space. Otherwise it was a comfortable and clean room. The bathroom is clean although it could do with a good scrub with bleaches at some corners, in the room we were staying in. The staff were very friendly and helpful. As we bought the Bus Turistic vouchers, we could hop on and off the buses, according to the routes provided. About 10 minute walk away, there are stops to pick up tourists on the Red Route. Otherwise, there are a lot of taxis around the area, and from reviews from other travellers, there are also buses you can take to the central locations. There is also the option of walking - from some of the tourist spot: roughly about 30 minutes away from Casa Batlio. Good to check out before hand where to go for food: we found Maitea Taberna, which is about 12- 15 minute walk from the hotel - a great value restaurant serving the best local food in the area. You can find reviews of the restaurant on Trip Advisor. We picked up breakfast from the pattiserie around the block. In cost about 40-45 Euros on the taxi to the airport from the hotel. It was well worth the money for 3 travellers. We booked a shuttle with Thomas Cook for our return journey to the airport for 55 Euros. On hindsight, it would have been alright to just get a taxi from the hotel. The hotel reception is able to arrange that on request. I will stay there again and will recommend friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: lillesten
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had 4 wonderful nights at this little gem of a hotel in October. The hotel is perfect if you have a couple of days in Barcelona. It's central, but it's not located on La Rambla. That only means you will get a good nights sleep and be kept up by all the nightlife. The hotel is within walking distance to most places if you like to walk. It took about half an hour to walk to La Rambla, Park Guell, and Sagrada Familia. There is so much to see and so many nice small cafes in this city that we didn't want to use the Metro system for our stay. We took a taxi back to the hotel a couple of times at night and it was only € 6-10. Lots of shopping and nice restaurants around the hotel. The staff was very helpful with directions, restaurants and what to see in the limited time we had available. I didn't find it a problem that there was no bar at the hotel as the self service bar worked perfectly for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet hotel with lots of shops and restaurants around the corner”
Reviews.Author: Henrik63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights with our two children (1.5 and 4) and we had a great stay in many ways. Our room was perfect laid out for a family of four and we could even let our 4 year old get "a room on his own" by making use of the sliding glass door between the sofa and bed parts of the room. Although traffic noise was high when you opened the door to the balcony it was compeltely blocked out as soon as the door was closed. I would agree that there is some internal noise in the hotel, but nothin more than in any other hotel. Our room was situated right next to the elevator and we had no elevator noise at all -- something that I have experienced at many other hotels (including high profiel hotels in Manhattan). The buffet breakfast was a great deal at EUR 12/person with both hot and cold choices and it took us through most of the day. Additionally, we were surprised to find so many bus services close by (Metro in BCN is not adapted to strollers so bus is the way to go) and we could take the bus to for instance the Acquarium, Barceloneta or Tibidado Blue Tram just by walking less than 200 m. Also the Barcelona Tour-buses had a stop very nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Would go there again”
Reviews.Author: Taran616
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Wilson Boutique and were very pleased with what we found. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff friendly and efficient, the triple(?) glazing kept most of the noise of the city out and the blackout curtains excellent!! Breakfast at 12 Euros was OK..... if you went out hungry you only had yourself to blame but we were disappointed that there was no evening restaurant on site. It would have been really nice to have had a night to eat in at the hotel. However a really great find was the college refectory opposite, good food with excellent wine, superb service at a reasonable cost, very highly recommended. As a veggie I had trouble finding food without meat/fish but they did their best. Would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: L0rna
Reviews.Content: Although we arrived to find that the room we reserved wasn't available (top floor) we did enjoy our stay. We packed our bags the next day and the staff moved us into our reserved room. Other people have mentionned the hotel is out-of-the-way. It is not 'downtown' but a bus ride (I think #64) will take you to the beach and #7 gets you to the main square. We did take a couple of taxis and they were between 6 and 10 euro. It was really nice to stay in an area out of the congested area of La Rambla. As for comments the staff were not friendly - I think this might be a difference in cultural perspectives. We interacted quite a bit with the front desk staff and although they were not 'North American' outgoing they were very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “A very, very nice hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Tina-LC
Reviews.Content: The staff at Wilson Boutique Hotel, Barcelona, were all very helpful and we sensed that they were deeply commited in their job. Breakfast was served in a very nice room, and what a great breakfast! The room was clean and nice. The staff went out to get us a taxi when the taxicompany failed to send us one. We would love to go back to Wilson Hotel, thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Deiina
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful and very modern. The reception lady, she was in her late 40s or early 50s was a bit mean to us, but the rest was veryyyyy good. Free Internet access-computer and there was a young man helping us with the luggage. I loved Barcelona. Ill definitely reserve my next visit in Wilson's

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mauser
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Wilson Boutique 3 nights before our cruise. Good location on Avenida Diagonal. Had a room on seventh floor, facing the street and never heard the traffic. This hotel was remodeled in 2008 and it is very,very nice. Would stay here again. Mauser

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: sc1858
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. Staff, service and rooms were second to none and central location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: tracemcd81
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Wilson on our first trip to Barcelona. Having read previous reviews, I was aware that it was not directly in the centre or on La Rambla however the stylish boutique style appeared worth the walk and, after all, isn't that the best way to see the city!! The hotel is situated on a gorgeous, tree lined avenue, with many stylish shops and restaurants either side. It only took 5 minutes to walk to the nearest metro, Diagonal, which is only 1 stop away from all the action although we actually only used it once (when our feet were quite tired from walking) - choosing to walk to La Rambla which took approx 30 minutes (but a lovely walk). The reception area is very modern however we found reception staff to be less than helpful and quite rude to be honest - no welcoming smile unfortunately which I think goes a long way. The porter was excellent however, showing us to our room, and wouldn't hear of me wheeling my own suitcase there! Every time we returned, a porter was waiting who called the lift for us, a nice touch. The room was very modern with a very stylish interior. The bathroom area was quite open (fine for a couple however I wouldn't feel comfortable sharing with anyone other than a partner/very close friend) and a nice selection of toiletries provided. We also had a lovely balcony overlooking the main street which was really pretty however, due to being on the main street, the traffic noise was quite loud, though not particularly an issue. Aside from that, the room was rather basic, quite small and basic. The bed also wasn't overly comfortable however in a city like Barcelona, who wants to lie in bed?? I'm also a little confused how this can be classed as a hotel as there is no restaurant/bar. The only reason I can think that they get around this is by offering a self service whereby you can help yourself to some drinks/snacks and inform reception of what you have consumed. As we didn't take breakfast, I can't comment. So all in all, not a disappointment, but feel that when we return to Barcelona we'll opt for a hotel situated in a more central location, with a bar/restaurant on site, just for handiness sake.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: abbiati
Reviews.Content: First of all, I booked that hotel from their official web site (not from other bookings webs, where every portal has own allotment). And i was very surprised, that the hotel was overbooked when I arrived. So, as usual, the problem was explained as a electricity problem and they accommodated me in suite room. The room was spacious and nice, we have ordered twin beds and there were two single beds. But after the breakfast (breakfast were ok) we were told to leave that room and change to "our" where electricity problem had solved. New room was not prepared after breakfast and changing rooms were planned on standard check-in time after 2pm. Of course, I argued with that option but i was told to pay extra money to stay in that room or all my staff could be easily put off and bring to the new room by housekeepers. I approved this changing, and option that my staff'd be removed by housekeepers and went to the town. At the evening, i found out (my staff was carefully removed, its no complaints at all) that the new room had a king size bed. But we needed the twin beds. Head of the reception told me 10x time sorry, but there no free rooms with twin beds in standard category rooms, and if we want, we can pay an extra to return again to that first-night-suite. Maybe I'm wrong, but i had 4 years experience in hotel industry and found out that overbooking and rooming policy as a terrible and not professional at all. I argued with manager on duty but did not want to make a scandal after listening million time how he was sorry about it and did nothing i approved new room and asked for another blanket. Of course, two next nights weren't comfortable at all, and it spoiled the whole impression of that hotel. Location was bad. Too far for leisure/beach and sun tourists. and too far from metro stations. Thanks God, taxi was not so expensive. Breakfast were good, they are worth to be extra paid. Rooms were very modern, bathroom was spacious, marble. Reception guys were very friendly and helpful, they perfectly understand terrible behavior of their leads, but they could not do anything. After check out one reception guy helped us with our luggage which was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LadybootsLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. Clean stylish rooms, with all modern amenities, including free internet (which I always appreciate!) Friendly helpful staff, I happily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: escampiones
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in Barcelona, so we decided to stay at a different location than the old town, where we stayed before. We couldn't have picked a better choice. The neighborhood was beautiful, pleasant 10 minute walk to the metro, bus stops right in front (handy to the Sants station), shopping terrific, restaurants and bars range from good budget to great highend (Bar Michigan to Dapps restaurant). The room we had was a junior suite, powerful a/c, quiet depite its proximity to the elevator. We found staff extremely helpful, English speaking. Requests we made were quickly followed through. They let us keep an iron and board for the duration of our stay, which some hotels do not even provide.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Dawn48
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this modern hotel was excellent. We found the staff to be very heplful, nothing was too much trouble. The room we had was a triple which was extremely comfortable and modern. The power shower was to die for just what was needed after a day pounding the streets of this fantastic city. Metro about a 10 minuite walk from the hotel. Plenty of nice places to eat nearby. When we return to Barcelona we shall amost certainly book The Wilson Boutique Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Aich
Reviews.Content: Excellent modern facilities and good value if you are willing for a bit of a walk from the metro. There are some excellent places to eat and drink nearby and its far more relaxing than being down by La Rambla. There is some road noise on the road side but not anywhere near as much as similar priced older property down town - where we stayed a few nights earlier. It would help if the security boxes in the room were actually fixed to something!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre/Post Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: vl4tbl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom pre and post cruise. We stayed in one of the corner suites, that were super modern and roomy. The bed was a bit hard, but I am told that it is common throughout Europe. The free internet was a great resource for printing off tickets or checking our email. The staff was very nice and knowledgeable. It is about a 5-10 minute walk to the Paseo de Gracia but May was the perfect time of year to go and walk the tree lined streets. Its nice place for those trying to escape the noise and chaos of Las Ramblas at night. I would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable hotel with friendly staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: annepellicci
Reviews.Content: Wilson Boutique Hotel was an ideal beginning to our European vacation. Staff were friendly , location was central to all that we required and the breakfasts were scrumptious. Only downside was that very few of the reception desk staff that we encountered spoke english.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and nice area”
Reviews.Author: Gavinw78
Reviews.Content: I read reviews about this hotel before leaving and was a bit worried by reviews that said the location wasn't great. However when we got there, we didn't find it a problem at all. In fact, we took a taxi from the aerobus drop off (placa catalunya) and it was only 5 euros up the street to the hotel. From then on in, we walked everywhere and avoided the metro. During the hotel we visted the Ramblas and to be honest I'm glad we were a little outside the main centre as that place is so busy. So my big point is please don't be put off location - it's actually in a really nice area, surrounded by good cafes, bars, restaurants and a little park. The rooms are clean, and all face out onto the Diagonal. Rooms have a safe and you can get the key at reception. They didn't have BBC world service on their tv, so if you like a quick news fix in the morning before you head out I hope you can understand Spanish. Free wireless is available, but if you haven't brought a computer, they have one with free access on the ground floor. We stayed for 8 days and found staff friendly and helpful, they will phone to book tables in local restaurants if you can't speak Spanish - which was great because at the weekend you need to book ahead for a good restaurant. Hotel breakfast was 12euros each so we give that a miss and headed to local nearby cafes for a morning coffee and snack. The 27 bus stops right outside the door! and will take you to Sants railway station in 10 minutes. From here you can easily take a day trip to Stiges which is beautiful. Cross the street from the hotel and you can take the bus downtown towards the main placa catalunya and go sight seeing. If I get the chance to go back to Barcelona, I hope this hotel is still there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - consider location”
Reviews.Author: confusion26
Reviews.Content: The Wilson is a really modern hotel, with good taste. You can get a room with a view on Avenida Diagonal, ours had a view over the side alley. There might be some noise at night from a bar nearby, but generally we were not disturbed. The hotel is located near bus stops that are served both by day and night buses going to Placa Catalunya and the metro station, but it is a 10 minute walk to the closest metro station if you plan not to use buses. The hotel offers free Wi-fi, the staff is very helpful and kind, and there is a buffet where you can buy snacks throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly like the website.”
Reviews.Author: AD1GIBSON
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room with excellent views. Ten minute walk to metro but a walk down Rambla worth the shoe leather. Would go back. No coffee and tea making in room if I was being picky.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: china_chick1289
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Wilson hotel in Barcelona for a few nights and it was fantastic. We were given a room on the 7th floor with views over the whole of Barcelona. The room was huge and very bright; we also had our own private balcony which was also very large. The staff were always very friendly and helpful and spoke very good English. The breakfasts were nice but were quite expensive. It turns out that there are some cafes just around the corner and a Starbucks further up the road. The location is very central; the metro stop is about a 10 minute walk and there is no shortage of taxis around! Although the street is very noisy, the windows are double glazed and we didn't hear anything. Great value hotel- will definitely stay here again next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish and comfortable hotel with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: StockholmCat
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for 4 nights at the Wilson and we really enjoyed it. We stayed in a suite on the 6th floor. The hotel is located on Avenida Diagonal, in the business area of Barcelona, and can easily be reached by buses that pass all the time. We never had to wait more than 5 minutes for one to the nearest Metro. Bus stop no 7 stops right outside the door. The hotel was very quiet and not crowded. The room was very nice and clean and modern. Windows were properly insulated and curtains shut out all sunlight in the morning. The staff was very friendly and very helpful at all times. A big plus was the breakfast buffé that was more than complete and enjoyable. It's not included in the rate but was worth the extra 12 euro we thought. As a big breakfast eater I was very pleased. There was free internet access in the lobby that we used a lot and was very useful. In other case there was free wireless internet access in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great great value, but you need to consider location”
Reviews.Author: birdyba
Reviews.Content: Very in line with most reviews of the Wilson, it's a great hotel since renovated last year. The decor is great, modern, good taste. Cleanliness, perfect. The room was large, well-equipped and had wi-fi. Can't commnet on breakfast service or food cause we ate out all the time. Two things to consider in my view, and location is the first. The hotel is in a beautiful neigborhood on Avinguda Diagonal, very nice shops all around and excellent bars. However, if it´s your first time in Barcelona you might want to consider something closer to Las Ramblas, otherwise after walking all day getting to know the city, you'll end up taking a cab every night. Second thought goes to staff: seems everyone is new or every problem seems new to them. Fixing a lighting problem, providing a proper wine opener, or solving a minor issue with a suitcase lock were all things they resolved with good disposition but limited skill and timeliness. Probably all things they will get better at once the've had more time at the job. All in all, I would definitely stay again at the Wilson on a second visit to Barcelona is the price stays as it is now!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, modern & central”
Reviews.Author: S_SimmonsMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in this fully modern and lovely hotel. Our room was a triple and it was huge! Loved the breakfasts, incredible choice and leisurely hours.
