Very central, staff were helpful and friendly and they were very kind to our active 4 year old. Highly recommend to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Honey Moon”
Reviews.Author: IuliaI
Reviews.Content: Wilson hotel is an average hotel but I loved it because is placed on Avigunda Diagonal very near to Las Ramblas. Has nice personell and clean, confortable rooms, not big but enough for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: zlw31
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just spent a long weekend in Barcelona staying at the Wilson Boutique Hotel which I have to say was one of the best boutique hotels I've stayed in. The location was a bit farther out of the main tourist area (30mins walk to La Ramblas or 10mins walk to Diagonal metro stop) but this was exactly what we wanted as it was much quieter at night. The hotel was ultra modern - frosted glass bathroom, flat screen TV, various levels of lighting - and we were lucky enough to have a balcony with a view out over Avenida Diagonal. The room we had was very spacious (Room 702). We would definately stay here again and would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to stay slightly out of the hectic part of Barcelona in a cool hotel! A tip for anyone with a bit of surplus money that wants an alternative tour of Barcelona - contact Edgar at Barcelona Segway Glides. We spent 3hrs with him whizzing around on Segways which was such a laugh.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: PWhitman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Wilson Boutique Hotel for one night on a 24 hour business trip to Barcelona. Booked a double room via their website for €80 (reduced from €100). Hotel is about 20 minutes from the airport by taxi (early evening) and costs about €20-€30. Easy check-in, very spacious room on 7th floor - contemporary decor/furnishings and slightly unusual layout made a refreshing change from a standard business hotel. Free wifi was easy to connect and rain-head shower made for a good start to the day. All in all an excellent hotel for my needs (location was great as my client was on Av. Diagonal) and wouldn't hesitate to use again. Would also consider for a personal trip as it really isn't that far to walk to the main sites or to link into the excellent transport system.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for first timers in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Kennythedub
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at this Hotel and can thoroughly recommend it .The hotel is located in a very safe area but may be a drawback for some that its a 15minute walk(but plenty of shops along the way) to nearest metro(Dioganal,which is 2 stops from La Ramblas).the hotel itself was extremely clean and very well run,We didn't eat at the hotel as there was plenty of eating spots closeby.The hotel is situated at a very busy junction but there was no traffic noise audible in our room .Overall a good hotel to stay in if you dont want the hussle and bussle of staying in the Ramblas..................we hope to go back to Barcelona (a fantastic city)soon and wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Wilson again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel not convinced about the location”
Reviews.Author: simon466
Reviews.Content: We had three nights in Barcelona and were looking for a good value hotel with a good location! Certainly this is a very nice hotel, we paid around £59 per night and were very happy with the room. However I have to disagree with many reviews on here regarding the location? Although it was centrally placed in relation to the three main districts, everything required a lengthy walk or transportation. The Metro stations were not partiulary conveniently place and getting to the main square 'Place de catalunya' was not easy, particurlary with luggage. We seemed to gravitate to towards the Old Quarter, La Ramble etc and in hindsight saw many alternatively positioned hotels which were much better located and suited to our needs. Having said that, for a three star hotel the rooms were excellent, and very clean, although Tea & Coffee facilities would have been welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: Membio
Reviews.Content: Quite and clean. Friendly helpful staff. Nice after hours self serve coffee and bar. Off the tourist track near lots of local bars and restaurants of all flavours. Free internet computer with printer, free wireless or the use of a cable if signal strength was weak-- which is was.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Hilde43
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our 3 day Barcelona break due to its location, price, and good previous reveiws. We can't add much more other then to say all the previous good reviews were correct. Rooms are good, clean tidy and modern. Location is excellent, a little out from the old town but easily accessed by metro. Lots of good food/drink/tapas places close to the hotel as well as shopping. Staff very friendly. Overall hard to fault really.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute hotel in a great location!!”
Reviews.Author: cynmari
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel earlier this year as part of a company trip and I was really surprised! The rooms were clean, super cute, and the location was fantastic for seeing Barcelona! Also, the staff was very nice....I came away from the experience thinking that I would even book it for myself if I went to Barcelona on vacation. For a 3 star it was definitely impressive!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in minimal chic style”
Reviews.Author: martiago
Reviews.Content: This summer we planned to reach Barcelona by boat and we chose Wilson Boutique Hotel thanks a very special offer. Nice hotel in minimal chic style, good service - also speaking Italian! - and our room was lovely. I liked also the crystal shower just in the room. Maybe the only hotel's weakness is its position, good if you have a car - or a motorbike like we had - but not so good if you have to go on foot. Free internet of course and agreement with a parking in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: viccij
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern hotel, good service and room amenities. Location bit of a hike to nearest underground, 10 mins easy. However good price for city location. Would stay again and recommend. No breakfast included however good cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wilson”
Reviews.Author: TOKYO64
Reviews.Content: It was a nice place to chill and it was located on Diagonal in a very convenient location. There was a nice breakfast in the morning and I could walk just about anywhere I liked in Barcelona. There were also a lot of nice restaurants, including a sushi place right near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel, Super City...”
Reviews.Author: drhako
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilson Boutique Hotel and were very pleased. Because we flew into Terminal 1 we used taxi from the airport to hotel. This only costs 27 euros (plus three big luggages) and is very comfortable of course for three. The decor of the our junior suite was very nice and modern. Bathroom is well equipped, newly remodeled with granite and tile. Shampoo, bath gel, hand soap and hair dryer are provided. Beds comfortable. Buffet breakfast was one of the best (12 euros /pp). Also there are a few coffee shops within 1 mins of the hotel so breakfast out was no problem. There is also a El Cortes Englais shopping center directly over the road from the hotel which is very useful. Desk staff helpful if you have questions about getting around. Everyone spoke English so we had no problems in that area. There is free internet access in the hotel. We would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, large room, modern, in a wonderful city, But get those comfy shoes on!”
Reviews.Author: jelcic
Reviews.Content: My partner and I hit Barcelona for 5 nights in November. We had picked the Wilson as it had good reviews and we love Boutique style hotels. The price was excellent. The room was a good size in relaxing creams and browns. There was a 32" LCD on the wall although we never watched it. There were several options for lighting including a dimmer switch over the bed which was nice for tired eyes. There was a fridge in the room with a well stocked mini bar and we thought the prices were very reasonable. The bathroom was modern with a nice rain shower head but no bath. The only thing i would complain about was the door to the bathroom was a sliding one and wasn't very sound proof...so make sure you know your partner well!!! A proper hairdryer was supplied so you needn't take your own and there was a diffuser attachment. We had a room overlooking the main road but the windows were very soundproofed and it was very quiet. We had a little look at the suites when the maid was around. She was more than happy to show us. Very large rooms and a bath, but for the time that we spent in the room we didn't think it was worth the extra. We didn't need to use the reception staff for anything but they seemed friendly enough and leant us wine glasses for the room so we could kick back with a nice bottle of red after a long days walk. We took the laptop and used the free WIFI in order to plan our days out, really handy. Getting to the hotel from the airport was easy. Turned right outside the airport doors and took the Aerobus in to the centre for about 5 euros. We then took a taxi to the hotel another 5 euros as we didn't want to wait for the number 7 bus but that would have taken you right outside the hotel. On the way home we heard the reception staff mention the Aerobus were on strike and when we enquired they said a taxi would be 40 euros. We decided to take the Renfe train which cost 2.60 euros so if we went back we would use this method instead, Really easy and straight into the terminal. If you do stay here be prepared to walk! It was probably a good 30 minute walk to the centre of things so we varied our route every day so as not to get bored by it. However we enjoyed exploring the back streets. On 2 of the days we took the Bus Touristique which we hopped on at the roundabout near the hotel. Great value for money and meant we got our bearings easily. We used this to see most of the sites and we loved the ability to hop on and off at leisure. We also had a nice stroll to the Sagrada Familia from the hotel through the Gracia district. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel but there were some nice coffee shops around the hotel in which you can get a coffee and croissant for under 2 euros. We ate on the Rambla de Catulunya which wasn't far from the hotel and had several restaurants and bars which come alive after dark and are great for people watching. You need to try the Tapas and Cava! We have decided that we will definately return to Barcelona as it was one of the best cities I have ever been to. I could ramble on about the things to see but there is just so much. Now that we know the areas a bit better we would probably choose to stay a bit closer to the El Born or Bari Gottic areas although then we may not get such a good deal and such a quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: pikelou
Reviews.Content: Brilliant friendly small hotel, clean soundproof rooms with designer detailing. We stayed in a suite that had a lovely view, huge bath..not sure its worth paying the extra for as peeking into the other rooms they also looked great...staff very friendly and helpful. Handy for tourist bus ( buy tickets at hotel) as well as bus and metro network, T10 card very useful..Location is along shop heaven, only 10min walk to Gothic Quarter / ramblas but prefered the location of the Wilson being slightly off the beaten tourist trap with good selection of restuarants and bars. thanks to all previous reviewers comments, especially the tip about terminal one Barcelona Airport Duty free shops.. Would recommend this hotel everytime

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: up1level
Reviews.Content: had a lovely 2 night stay here after 2 nights just off the ramblas and a night in sitges. it was great to be away from it all in a different district. the room was all it could have been although had to ask for extra pillows. nice cafe round the corner - berlin, and some great bars and restaurants nearby( particularly moon bar). dont think we could have found anything better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 20-22 October in Room 702! I would recommend requesting this room when booking as it has a large terrace with table and chairs! The Wilson Hotel is a beautiful place to stay in Barcelona, large modern bedroom and bathrooms! The breakfast is quite over priced for what you get. We only ate here because it poured down with rain! I would advise that you take the hotel address with you if you intend on getting taxi's as they have no idea where it is 9 times out of 10! Or ask for the "Hotel Wilsoon" and they tend to have a vague idea!! My only issue with the hotel is the location. Everything we had read said 15 minutes walk or a few minutes walk, we timed it from playa de catalunya and it took 35 minutes through the back streets and 45 minutes taking the most direct route, we obviously were not rushing but still we walked at a steady pace! We would highly recommend the hotel for your stay in Barcelona! Try to avoid October though as this is the rain-y month! Food-wise, you have to try QU QU for gorgeous Tapas and Citrus for a stunning 3 course meal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in the Shopping District of Barcelona near Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Marvelous_Travelers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic and modern. Large rooms by European standards and great bathrooms with toilet, bedet, double sinks, and a roomy standup shower. The hotel is on Avenida Dioganal which is one of the main shopping strips of Barcelona with stores like Loewe, Armani, and others. More importantly for tourists it is only 3-4 blocks from two different sightseeing bus and a short walk to the top of Las Ramblas. The staff was great, spoke excellent English and provided recommendations and directions to most everything. Free Internet in the hotel and I believe free wifi too. Great value for a great room. Completely recommend. You will not be disappointed. It was recommended to me by my cousin who lives in Madrid and he was right on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, quite poor location”
Reviews.Author: Ritarips
Reviews.Content: As stated in previous reviews: the rooms are lovely - clean, modern and well-sized. The staff is helpful and friendly. Our room was on the side of the hotel facing Av. Diagonal, which has heavy traffic for most of the day. The problem was not really the noise, rooms are soundproofed, but it's just not all that nice with all that traffic right outside. Would recommend to ask for room away from Av. Diagonal. As mentioned, the hotel is also quite far from most of the attractions and interessting sites: Passeig de Gracia (La Pedrera, Casa Battló), is 10 min. walk away. But a T10 card will come in handy (for public tranportation).

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtfully appointed”
Reviews.Author: cristinasabin
Reviews.Content: My husband, son (22 months) and I spent three nights at the Wilson after reading rave reviews on TA and finding a decent rate (100 euros/night). We were visiting Barcelona for the Fiesta de la Mercé y had a difficult time finding a hotel to accommodate three people. The hotel is a bit far from the city's attractions and is situated on one of the city's prime shopping/financial avenues but we loved the hotel. The rooms are tastefully and thoughtfully decorated, showcasing the artistic vibe of Barcelona. The beds were very comfortable and the room surprising spacious. The bathroom had a bath (very nice when traveling with a toddler), a strong shower, hairdryer and nice toiletries. The room itself featured a large, flat screen t.v. with many channels (not that we were there to watch t.v.). The hotel is situated on a busy street but the rooms are soundproofed and have shades that allow for sound sleeping. You will have to walk a bit to get to the city's attractions, however. The main desk was more than willing to help us navigate the bus system from the hotel and the city's attractions. We didn't go for the buffet breakfast because it seemed a bit pricey and we haven't had much success with Spanish hotel breakfasts. The hotel also has a small business center with a computer and printer (free use). I would certainly return to the Wilson Boutique Hotel and you should give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: WalesPudding
Reviews.Content: Contemporary chic hotel-room compact but stunning. Shower to die for and lovely balcony to sip wine at night and coffee in the mornings! Berlin Cafe outside hotel great for snacks and very friendly staff. Would highly recommend-nothing is too much trouble-service 1st class.

Reviews.Title: “sophistication at its best”
Reviews.Author: Zoologist_Bongo
Reviews.Content: Very sophisticated and has great food in the restaurant, great value for money. Fresh ingredients and luxurious. The staff were so friendly and helpful. The hotel and room decorations were stylish and I loved the classic car at the main entrance, a great place to take a phots. Definitely worth a visit! I will be staying again when I nect visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic high class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Agallego09
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room in great location and great value. Staff were very helpful especially guy out the front of the hotel was very friendly and informative, very comfortable and relaxing atmosphere, It was a fantastic high class hotel A+ Mr GAllego

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Nadymm
Reviews.Content: we checked at the Wilson for 5 days in august. I LOVED this hotel it's absolutely fantastic, the rooms are ultra modern, the bathroom is just wonderful, one of the rooms was larger than the other one, but that second one had a marvellous balcony with a magnificent view by day & night i totally reccomend this hotel located on the diagonal avenue, it is only minutes from bus stations, metros, and even La Rambla's extension i can't believe it's only 3 stars free wifi, wonderful cafeteria with an extremely stylish ambiance, i'd give it 4 1/2 stars easily

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY recommend...”
Reviews.Author: WGNGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely great! The staff was incredily friendly and helpful! Located just off the city center but only a couple of minutes walking distance to the main city center. Room was incredibly clean and neat and very trendy. I was delighted with the balcony that overlooked the Avda Diagonale with a bistro table and chairs to watch the sunset at night. Absolutely wonderful hotel and would highly recommend to anyone!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay away from home”
Reviews.Author: irislilyQc
Reviews.Content: Stylish modern hotel situated in one main streets of Barcelona. Very clean, big windows, floating wood flooring, good quality linens and I guess it's smoke free 'coz my room did not smell cigarette. Well equipped bar in the room. Free Wi-fi access. Had English programming in our 2nd night. Public transport is very accessible, about 15 mins. liesurely walk to Metro Diagonal or bus # 58 will take you to Plaza Catalunya or bus # 27 to Sants station. Staff speaks English.

HotelInfo.Name: Wilson Boutique Hotel
